exhibit.name: The Wonders of the Ocean
exhibit.description: Explore the fascinating world beneath the waves! This exhibit showcases the diverse ecosystems of the ocean, from coral reefs to deep-sea trenches.

age_group.kids: A fun and interactive way to learn about ocean life!
age_group.experts: In-depth analysis of marine biodiversity and ecological interactions.

highlights.title: Coral Reef Adventure
highlights.description: Dive into a virtual coral reef and learn about the species that inhabit this vibrant ecosystem.

age_appropriate.kids: Meet colorful fish and learn how corals grow!
age_appropriate.experts: Study the symbiotic relationships between corals and marine life.

highlights.title: Deep Sea Exploration
highlights.description: Discover the mysteries of the deep sea with our interactive displays and models.

age_appropriate.kids: See amazing creatures that glow in the dark!
age_appropriate.experts: Examine the adaptations of deep-sea organisms to extreme environments.

fun_facts: The ocean covers over 70% of the Earth's surface.
More than 90% of the ocean is unexplored and unmapped.
Coral reefs support about 25% of all marine species.

exhibit2.name: The Science of Flight
exhibit2.description: Discover the principles of aerodynamics and the history of aviation through interactive displays and flight simulators.

age_group.kids: Learn how planes fly and try your hand at flying a virtual aircraft!
age_group.experts: Explore the physics of flight and advancements in aerospace technology.

highlights.title: Flight Simulator Experience
highlights.description: Take control of a virtual plane and experience the thrill of flying.

age_appropriate.kids: Feel like a pilot as you soar through the skies!
age_appropriate.experts: Analyze flight dynamics and control systems.

highlights.title: History of Aviation
highlights.description: Learn about the pioneers of flight and the evolution of aircraft.

age_appropriate.kids: Meet famous aviators and see their planes!
age_appropriate.experts: Study the technological advancements in aviation history.

fun_facts: The Wright brothers made the first powered flight in 1903.
The fastest recorded speed of a manned aircraft is over 2,193 mph!
Birds have been inspiring flight technology for centuries.

exhibit3.name: Robotics Revolution
exhibit3.description: Explore the world of robotics and artificial intelligence through hands-on activities and demonstrations.

age_group.kids: Build your own robot and see it in action!
age_group.experts: Delve into the algorithms and technologies driving modern robotics.

highlights.title: Build-a-Robot Station
highlights.description: Create and program your own robot to complete challenges.

age_appropriate.kids: Have fun building and racing your robot!
age_appropriate.experts: Experiment with different sensors and programming languages.

highlights.title: AI in Action
highlights.description: Watch live demonstrations of robots performing complex tasks.

age_appropriate.kids: See robots dance and play games!
age_appropriate.experts: Analyze the machine learning techniques used in robotics.

fun_facts: The first industrial robot was introduced in 1961.
Robots can be found in many industries, from manufacturing to healthcare.
Some robots can learn from their experiences and improve over time.

exhibit4.name: The Wonders of Space
exhibit4.description: Journey through the universe and learn about planets, stars, and galaxies with immersive displays and planetarium shows.

age_group.kids: Blast off into space and discover the solar system!
age_group.experts: Investigate the latest discoveries in astrophysics and cosmology.

highlights.title: Planetarium Experience
highlights.description: Watch stunning visuals of the night sky and learn about celestial bodies.

age_appropriate.kids: See shooting stars and learn about constellations!
age_appropriate.experts: Explore the life cycles of stars and the structure of the universe.

highlights.title: Telescope Viewing
highlights.description: Look through telescopes to observe planets and stars.

age_appropriate.experts: Analyze the light spectra of distant stars.

fun_facts: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all the Earth's beaches.
The universe is approximately 13.8 billion years old.
